intro: Pavetta laurentii, commonly known as the African snowbell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy white or pale blue flowers that resemble bells, often blooming in late winter or early spring. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Pavetta laurentii is often found in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
